attributes.action: Include childcare providers in coronavirus package of economic support
attributes.additional_details:
Our nurseries are critical to ensuring working parents can continue to work. 

If nurseries have to close due to the coronavirus crisis, their terms of business mean that fees may not be payable, and even where not the case, many parents are likely to remove their children as they cannot afford to continue to pay or due to health concerns. When this is over, we all want our children to return to their nurseries, to familiar staff and settings. Please help our childcare providers survive this!
attributes.background: The chancellor has just announced that the hospitality and leisure industries will be supported over the coming months. This petition is to include childcare providers in the same measures to ensure they also survive this crisis.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions calling for the same action:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300210
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301836

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
